vi_translation: “Well, what's wrong with going with a friend, dear?” “Surely you can invite Cassie Hiney.” I would definitely invite Cassie Hiney, a truly nice, friendly, and stunningly beautiful girl, but unfortunately, she has an extremely sensitive last name[3].

Chuck Parson did not participate in organized sports, because to do so would distract from the larger goal of his life: to one day be convicted of homicide. “Hey, faggots,” he called.

Chuck Parson no participaba en deportes de grupo porque eso lo distraería de su principal objetivo en la vida: que algún día lo condenaran por homicidio. —Hola, maricas —dijo.
es_translation: I was thinking about another occurrence when the three of us simultaneously saw the human-shaped bottle of anabolic steroids known as Chuck Parson approaching us with some purpose. Chuck Parson sporlara katılmazdı çünkü bu, dikkatini hayatının en büyük amacından başka yöne çekerdi: bir gün cinayetten mahkûm edilmek. “Hey, ibneler,” diye seslendi.

vi: Tôi đang nghĩ dở vế tiếp theo thì cả ba thằng cùng trông thấy cái bình đựng hoóc-môn tăng cơ có hình dạng con người tên là Chuck Parson đang hằm hằm tiến lại phía chúng tôi. Chuck Parson không chơi trong đội thể thao nào cả vì như thế sẽ làm xao nhãng mục tiêu to tát của đời nó: một ngày nào đó được kết tội giết người. “Này, mấy thằng ái kia,” nó gọi.

Chuck Parson didn't play on any sports team because it would distract him from his life's grand goal: to one day be convicted of murder. "Hey, you fags," he called.

en: “Chuck,” I answered, as friendly as I could muster. Chuck hadn’t given us any serious trouble in a couple years—someone in cool kid land laid down the edict that we were to be left alone. So it was a little unusual for him even to talk to us.
es: —Chuck —le contesté lo más amigablemente que pude. Chuck no nos había causado ningún problema grave en los dos últimos años, porque alguien del bando de los guays había dado la orden de que nos dejaran en paz, así que Chuck ni siquiera nos dirigía la palabra.
es_translation: —Chuck —I responded as amicably as I could. Chuck hadn't caused us any serious problems in the last two years, because someone from the cool kids' side had given the order to leave us alone, so Chuck didn't even speak to us.
tr: Rol yapabileceğim kadar arkadaşça, “Chuck,” diye karşılık verdim. Chuck birkaç yıldır bize ciddi bir sorun yaratmıyordu... havalı çocuklar ülkesinden biri, rahat bırakılmamız gerektiğiyle ilgili bir ferman çıkarmıştı. Yani bizimle konuşması bile biraz tuhaftı.
tr_translation: As friendly as I could manage, I replied, "Chuck." Chuck hadn't caused us any serious problems for a few years... someone from the land of the cool kids had issued a decree that we should be left alone. So it was a bit strange for him to even talk to us.
vi: “Chào Chuck,” tôi đáp, dàn hòa cầu thân hết mức có thể. Mấy năm nay Chuck không xích mích gì nghiêm trọng với bọn tôi–có đứa trong đám có máu mặt đã phán rằng như thế là bọn tôi được yên thân. Thế nên khi chính Chuck bắt chuyện với bọn tôi thì điều này có vẻ kì kì.
vi_translation: "Hello Chuck," I replied, trying to be as conciliatory as possible. In recent years, Chuck hasn't had any serious conflicts with us—some of the more influential members had declared that this meant we were safe. So when Chuck himself started a conversation with us, it seemed a bit strange.

en: It was so pathetically easy to forget about Chuck, to talk about prom even though I didn’t give a shit about prom. Such was life that morning: nothing really mattered that much, not the good things and not the bad ones. We were in the business of mutual amusement, and we were reasonably prosperous.
es: Era patéticamente fácil olvidarse de Chuck y hablar del baile de graduación, aunque me importaba una mierda. Así era la vida aquella mañana: nada importaba demasiado, ni las cosas buenas ni las malas. Nos dedicábamos a divertirnos, y nos iba razonablemente bien.
es_translation: It was pathetically easy to forget about Chuck and talk about the prom, even though I didn't give a damn. That's how life was that morning: nothing mattered too much, neither the good things nor the bad. We were dedicated to having fun, and we were doing reasonably well.
tr: Chuck’ı boş verip hiç umurumda olmamasına rağmen baloyla ilgili konuşmak acınacak derecede kolaydı. O sabah hayat böyleydi: Hiçbir şey o kadar önemli değildi, iyi şeyler de, kötü şeyler de. Müşterek eğlence içindeydik ve epey başarılıydık.
tr_translation: Ignoring Chuck and talking about the prom, even though I didn't care at all, was pathetically easy. That morning, life was like this: Nothing was that important, neither the good things nor the bad things. We were in shared amusement and we were quite successful.
vi: Dễ như bỡn thế là đã quên được Chuck, để say sưa bàn tán về buổi dạ hội dù tôi chẳng mảy may quan tâm đến nó. Cái sự đời sáng ngày hôm ấy: chẳng có gì thực sự quá hệ trọng, cả chuyện tốt lẫn chuyện xấu. Chúng tôi bận mỗi việc mua vui tiêu khiển cho nhau, và chúng tôi đã ung dung hào phóng một cách rất chính đáng.
vi_translation: It was so easy to forget Chuck, to eagerly discuss the ball even though I didn't care about it at all. The events of that morning: nothing was really too important, neither the good nor the bad. We were only busy entertaining each other, and we were leisurely generous in a very rightful way.

en: “You just gotta tell her, man,” I said. “You just gotta say, ‘Angela, I really like you, but there’s something you need to know: when we go to my house and hook up, we’ll be watched by the twenty-four hundred eyes of twelve hundred black Santas.”
es: —Solo tienes que contárselo, tío —le dije—. Solo tienes que decirle: «Angela, me gustas, de verdad, pero hay algo que tienes que saber: cuando vayamos a mi casa y nos enrollemos, dos mil cuatrocientos ojos de mil doscientos Santa Claus negros nos observarán».
es_translation: —You just have to tell her, man —I said to him—. You just have to say: "Angela, I really like you, but there's something you need to know: when we go to my house and we make out, two thousand four hundred eyes of twelve hundred black Santa Clauses will be watching us."
tr: “Dostum, Angela’ya söylemelisin,” dedim. “Demen gereken şu: ‘Angela, senden gerçekten hoşlanıyorum ama bilmen gereken bir şey var: Evime gidip oynaştığımızda, bin iki yüz zenci Noel babamn iki bin dört yüz gözü tarafından izleniyor olacağız.
tr_translation: “Buddy, you need to tell Angela,” I said. “What you need to say is this: ‘Angela, I really like you, but there’s something you need to know: When we go to my place and fool around, we will be watched by twelve hundred black Santa Clauses' two thousand four hundred eyes.”
vi: “Ông chỉ việc nói với Angela thôi,” tôi nói. “Đại loại như, ‘Angela này, tớ thực sự thích cậu, nhưng có điều này cậu cần phải biết: khi ở trong nhà tớ và dính lấy nhau, tụi mình sẽ được quan sát bằng hai ngàn bốn trăm con mắt của một ngàn hai trăm ông già Noel da đen.
vi_translation: “You just need to talk to Angela,” I said. “Something like, ‘Angela, I really like you, but there’s something you need to know: when we’re at my house and close together, we’ll be watched by two thousand four hundred eyes of one thousand two hundred black Santas.’”

en: I laughed awkwardly, then walked over and knelt by the window, my face inches from hers. I couldn’t imagine why she was here, in my window, like this. “To what do I owe the pleasure?” I asked. Margo and I were still friendly, I guess, but we weren’t meet-in-the-dead-of-night-wearing-black-face-paint friendly. She had friends for that, I’m sure. I just wasn’t among them.
es: Me reí con torpeza y luego me acerqué a la ventana, me arrodillé y me coloqué a solo unos centímetros de su cara. No podía imaginarme por qué estaba allí, en mi ventana, y con la cara pintada. —¿A qué debo el placer? —le pregunté. Margo y yo seguíamos teniendo buen rollo, supongo, pero no hasta el punto de quedar en plena noche con la cara pintada de negro. Para eso ya tenía a sus amigos, seguro. Yo no estaba entre ellos.
es_translation: I laughed awkwardly and then approached the window, knelt down, and positioned myself just a few centimeters from his face. I couldn't imagine why he was there, at my window, with his face painted. —To what do I owe the pleasure? —I asked him. Margo and I still had a good vibe, I suppose, but not to the point of meeting in the middle of the night with our faces painted black. For that, she already had her friends, surely. I was not among them.
tr: Tuhaf bir şekilde, güldüm, sonra oraya doğru yürüdüm, pencerenin kenarına diz çöküp oturdum, yüzüm onunkine çok yalandı. Neden burada, penceremde, bu şekilde olduğunu tahmin edemedim. “Bu şerefi neye borçluyum?” diye sordum. Margo’yla hâlâ samimiydik, sanırım ama “gecenin köründe siyah boyalı bir yüzle buluşma” ayarlayacak kadar değil. Bunun için de arkadaşları olduğuna «minim. Sadece ben onların arasında değildim.
tr_translation: Strangely, I laughed, then walked over there, knelt by the window, and sat down, my face very close to hers. I couldn't guess why she was here, at my window, in this manner. “To what do I owe this honor?” I asked. I was still close with Margo, I think, but not close enough to arrange a “meeting in the dead of night with a face painted black.” She had friends for that. I just wasn't among them.
vi: Tôi cười như mếu, rồi đi đến cửa sổ và quì xuống, mặt tôi chỉ cách mặt cô ấy vài phân. Tôi không thể hiểu được sao cô ấy lại ở đây, bên cửa sổ phòng tôi, như thế này. “Sao tớ lại có vinh hạnh này đây?” tôi hỏi. Margo và tôi vẫn là bạn bè, tôi nghĩ thế, nhưng không phải kiểu bạn gặp-nhau-lúc-nửa-đêm-với-bộ-mặt-bôi-đen. Tôi dám chắc cô ấy có bạn bè cho kiểu hoàn cảnh này. Và tôi không nằm trong số bạn đó.
vi_translation: I smiled wryly, then walked to the window and knelt down, my face just a few inches from hers. I couldn't understand why she was here, by my window, like this. "Why do I have this honor?" I asked. Margo and I were still friends, I thought, but not the kind of friends who meet-in-the-middle-of-the-night-with-blackened-faces. I was sure she had friends for this kind of situation. And I was not one of those friends.

es_translation: Margo hesitated for just a moment. —Dad, answering that question would take hours and I know you're probably very tired, so go back to...

tr_translation: Margo hesitated for a very brief moment. “Dad, answering this question would require me to tell stories for hours, and I know you're probably very tired, so just go back...”

en: “Yeah, I know,” Margo answered. “There’s school tomorrow and the day after that, and thinking about that too long could make a girl bonkers. So, yeah. It’s a school night. That’s why we’ve got to get going, because we’ve got to be back by morning.”
es: —Sí, lo sé —me contestó Margo—. Mañana tenemos clase, y pasado mañana, y si lo pienso demasiado, acabaré zumbada. Así que sí, es una noche antes de clase. Por eso tenemos que irnos ya, porque tenemos que estar de vuelta por la mañana.
es_translation: —Yes, I know —Margo replied to me—. We have class tomorrow, and the day after tomorrow, and if I think about it too much, I'll end up going crazy. So yes, it is a night before class. That's why we have to leave now, because we need to be back by morning.
tr: Margo, “Evet, biliyorum,” diye karşılık verdi. ‘Yarın okul var ve ondan sonraki gün de, bunun üzerine çok uzun süre düşünmek bir kıza keçileri kaçırtabüir. Yani evet, yann okul var. Başlamak zorunda olmamızın nedeni de bu, çünkü sabah geri dönmüş olmalıyız.
tr_translation: Margo replied, "Yes, I know." 'There is school tomorrow and the day after that, thinking about this for too long can drive a girl crazy. So yes, there is school tomorrow. That's why we have to start, because we need to be back by morning."
vi: “Ừa, tớ biết chứ,” Margo đáp. “Mai phải đi học, ngày kia cũng thế, cơ mà con trai suy đi tính lại lâu la có thể khiến con gái cáu điên lên đấy. Rồi, coi như đây là trường học ban đêm đi. Thế nên bây giờ chúng ta đi, vì phải trở về trước khi trời sáng.
vi_translation: “Yeah, I know,” Margo replied. “We have to go to school tomorrow, and the day after too, but boys taking a long time to think things through can drive girls crazy. Alright, let's consider this night school. So now we go, because we have to be back before dawn.”

en: And so I went. I slid out the window, and we ran along the side of my house, heads down, until we opened the doors of the minivan. Margo whispered not to close the doors—too much noise—so with the doors open, I put it in neutral, pushed off the cement with my foot, and then let the minivan roll down the driveway. We rolled slowly past a couple houses before I turned on the engine and the headlights. We closed the doors, and then I drove through the serpentine streets of Jefferson Park’s endlessness, the houses all still new-looking and plastic, like a toy village housing tens of thousands of real people.
es: Y fui. Salté por la ventana y corrimos por la pared lateral de mi casa con la cabeza agachada hasta que abrimos las puertas del monovolumen. Margo me susurró que no cerrara las puertas —demasiado ruido—, así que, con las puertas abiertas, puse el coche en punto muerto, empujé con el pie en el asfalto, y el monovolumen rodó por el camino. Avanzamos despacio hasta dejar atrás un par de casas y luego encendí el motor y las luces. Cerramos las puertas y conduje por las sinuosas calles de la interminable Jefferson Park, con sus casas que todavía parecían nuevas y de plástico, como un pueblo de juguete que albergara decenas de miles de personas reales.
es_translation: And I went. I jumped out the window and we ran along the side wall of my house with our heads down until we opened the doors of the minivan. Margo whispered to me not to close the doors —too much noise—, so, with the doors open, I put the car in neutral, pushed off with my foot on the asphalt, and the minivan rolled down the driveway. We moved slowly past a couple of houses and then I turned on the engine and the lights. We closed the doors and I drove through the winding streets of the endless Jefferson Park, with its houses that still looked new and plastic, like a toy town that housed tens of thousands of real people.
tr: Ben de gittim. Pencereden dışarı doğru kaydım ve arabanın kapılarım açana kadar, evimin yan tarafı boyunca başımız aşağıda koştuk. Margo kapılan kapatmamam için fısıldadı çok ses yapacaktıve öylece açık kapılarla, arabayı boşa alıp ayağımla ittim ve garaj ile cadde arasındaki yoldan kaydırdım. Ben motoru ve farları açma dan önce, birkaç evin önünden yavaşça geçtik. Kapıları kapattık ve sonra Jefferson Park’m sonsuzluğunun kıvrımlı sokaklarında arabayı sürdüm, evlerin hepsi hâlâ yeni görünümlü ve plastikti, on binlerce gerçek insanın barındığı oyuncak bir köy gibi.
tr_translation: I went too. I slid out through the window and ran along the side of my house, heads down, until I opened the car doors. Margo whispered not to close the doors because it would make too much noise, so with the doors left open, I put the car in neutral, pushed it with my foot, and slid it down the path between the garage and the street. I didn't turn on the engine or the headlights Before that, we slowly passed in front of a few houses. We closed the doors and then I drove the car through the winding streets of Jefferson Park's infinity, with all the houses still looking new and plastic, like a toy village housing tens of thousands of real people.
vi: Và thế là tôi đi. Tôi lặng lẽ nhảy qua cửa sổ, và chúng tôi khom người chạy dọc hông nhà, cho đến khi mở được cửa chiếc minivan. Margo thì thầm bảo đừng đóng cửa xe–như vậy gây tiếng động quá lớn–thế là với cửa xe để mở, tôi không khởi động xe mà thò chân ra đẩy xuống nền xi-măng, để xe từ từ lăn xuống đường. Chúng tôi chầm chậm qua mấy ngôi nhà rồi tôi mới khởi động máy và bật đèn. Chúng tôi đóng cửa xe, và tôi bắt đầu lái qua những con phố ngoằn ngoèo tưởng như vô tận của khu Jefferson Park, những căn nhà còn mới và bằng chất dẻo, trông như một ngôi làng đồ chơi với hàng chục ngàn con người bằng xương bằng thịt.
vi_translation: And so I went. I quietly jumped through the window, and we crouched and ran along the side of the house until we could open the door of the minivan. Margo whispered not to close the car door—it would make too much noise—so with the door left open, I didn't start the car but pushed my foot against the cement, letting the car slowly roll down the road. We slowly passed a few houses before I started the engine and turned on the lights. We closed the car door, and I began driving through the seemingly endless winding streets of Jefferson Park, the houses still new and made of plastic, looking like a toy village with tens of thousands of real people.

en: Margo managed to speak in her usual manic soliloquy without answering my question. “Did you know that for pretty much the entire history of the human species, the average life span was less than thirty years? You could count on ten years or so of real adulthood, right? There was no planning for retirement. There was no planning for a career. There was no planning. No time for planning. No time for a future. But then the life spans started getting longer, and people started having more and more future, and so they spent more time thinking about it. About the future. And now life has become the future. Every moment of your life is lived for the future—you go to high school so you can go to college so you can get a good job so you can get a nice house so you can afford to send your kids to college so they can get a good job so they can get a nice house so they can afford to send their kids to college.”
es: Margo se las arregló para soltarme uno de sus habituales monólogos frenéticos sin contestar a mi pregunta. —¿Sabías que, durante casi toda la historia de la especie humana, el promedio de vida ha sido inferior a treinta años? Disponían de unos diez años de vida adulta, ¿no? No planificaban su jubilación. No planificaban su carrera profesional. No planificaban nada. No tenían tiempo para hacer planes. No tenían tiempo para pensar en el futuro. Pero luego las expectativas de vida empezaron a aumentar y la gente empezó a tener cada vez más futuro, así que pasaba más tiempo pensando en él. En el futuro. Y ahora la vida se ha convertido en el futuro. Vives cada instante de tu vida por el futuro… Vas al instituto para poder ir a la universidad, y así podrás encontrar un buen trabajo, y así podrás comprarte una bonita casa, y así podrás permitirte mandar a tus hijos a la universidad para que puedan encontrar un buen trabajo y así puedan comprarse una bonita casa y así puedan permitirse mandar a sus hijos a la universidad.
es_translation: Margo managed to unleash one of her usual frenetic monologues without answering my question. —Did you know that, for almost the entire history of the human species, the average lifespan has been less than thirty years? They had about ten years of adult life, right? They didn't plan for retirement. They didn't plan their professional career. They didn't plan anything. They didn't have time to make plans. They didn't have time to think about the future. But then life expectancy started to increase and people began to have more and more future, so they spent more time thinking about it. About the future. And now life has become the future. You live every moment of your life for the future… You go to high school so you can go to college, and that way you can find a good job, and that way you can buy a nice house, and that way you can afford to send your kids to college so they can find a good job and that way they can buy a nice house and that way they can afford to send their kids to college.
tr: Margo her zamanki delice monologunda soruma cevap vermeden konuşmayı başardı. “Neredeyse tüm insanlık tarihinde, ortalama yaşam süresinin otuz yıldan az olduğunu biliyor muydun? On yıl falan gerçek yetişkinlik yaşayacağına güvenebiliyormuşsun, değil mi? Emekliliği planlamak yokmuş. Kariyer planlamak yokmuş. Planlamak yokmuş. Plan yapmak için zaman yokmuş. Gelecek için zaman yokmuş. Ama sonra yaşam süreleri uzamaya başlamış ve insanlar gittikçe daha fazla geleceğe sahip olmaya başlamış ve böylece konu hakkında düşünmek için daha fazla zaman harcamışlar. Gelecek hakkında. Ve şimdi hayat gelecek haline geldi. tr_translation: Margo, as usual, managed to speak in her crazy monologue without answering my question. “Did you know that for almost all of human history, the average lifespan was less than thirty years? There was no time to make plans. There was no time for the future. But then lifespans started to increase, and people began to have more and more of a future, so they spent more time thinking about it. About the future. And now life has become the future. Every moment of your life is lived for the future... you go to high school so you can go to college, so you can get a good job, so you can buy a nice house, so you can afford to send your kids to college, so your kids can get a good job, so they can buy a nice house, so they can afford to send their kids to college.”

"You know, from ancient times and for a very long period in human history, the average lifespan of humans was less than thirty. That means people had about ten years of adulthood, right? es: —Bueno, esto complica las cosas —dijo Margo al ver que estaba cerrado. Se metió una mano en el bolsillo y sacó un trozo de alambre que alguna vez había sido una percha. Tardó menos de un minuto en desbloquear la cerradura. Me quedé sorprendido, por supuesto.
es_translation: —Well, this complicates things —said Margo upon seeing that it was closed. He put a hand in his pocket and took out a piece of wire that had once been a hanger. It took him less than a minute to unlock the lock. I was surprised, of course.
tr: “Şey, bu durumu daha da zorlaştırıyor,” dedi Margo arabanın kilitli olduğunu görünce. Cebine uzandı ve bir zamanlar elbise askısı olan bir parça tel çıkardı. Kilidi açması bir dakikadan daha az zamanını aldı. Hayran kaldım tabii ki.
tr_translation: “Well, this makes things even more difficult,” said Margo when she saw that the car was locked. She reached into her pocket and pulled out a piece of wire that was once a clothes hanger. It took her less than a minute to unlock the car. Of course, I was impressed.
vi: “Chà, thế này sẽ khó hơn đây,” Margo nói khi thấy xe được khóa. Cô ấy tìm trong túi và lấy ra một đoạn dây kim loại từng là cái mắc áo. Chưa đầy một phút Margo đã mở được cửa xe. Tôi chỉ biết ngây ra thán phục.
vi_translation: “Well, this is going to be harder,” Margo said when she saw the car was locked. She searched in her bag and took out a piece of wire that used to be a coat hanger. In less than a minute, Margo had the car door open. I could only stand there in awe.

en: “He was a senior when we were freshmen,” she answered. “We gotta hustle, okay? Time’s a-wastin’.” Margo started taking the stairs two at a time, flying up, one arm on the rail, and I tried to keep pace with her, but couldn’t. Margo didn’t play any sports, but she liked to run—I sometimes saw her running by herself listening to music in Jefferson Park. I, however, did not like to run. Or, for that matter, engage in any kind of physical exertion. But now I tried to keep up a steady pace, wiping the sweat off my forehead and ignoring the burning in my legs. When I got to the twenty-fifth floor, Margo was standing on the landing, waiting for me.
es: —Estaba en el último curso del instituto cuando nosotros íbamos a primero —me contestó—. Tenemos que darnos prisa, ¿vale? Se nos acaba el tiempo. Margo empezó a subir los escalones de dos en dos, a toda velocidad y con una mano en la barandilla, y yo intenté seguirle el paso, pero no podía. Margo no hacía deporte, pero le gustaba correr. De vez en cuando la veía en Jefferson Park corriendo sola con los cascos puestos. Pero a mí no me gustaba correr. Es más, no me gustaba hacer el más mínimo esfuerzo físico. Pero intenté mantener el paso firme, secarme el sudor de la frente e ignorar que me ardían las piernas. Cuando llegué a la planta veinticinco, Margo estaba esperándome en el descansillo.
es_translation: —He was in the last year of high school when we were in the first year —he answered me—. We have to hurry up, okay? We're running out of time. Margo started climbing the steps two at a time, at full speed and with one hand on the railing, and I tried to keep up with her, but I couldn't. Margo didn't play sports, but she liked to run. From time to time, I saw her in Jefferson Park running alone with her headphones on. But I didn't like running. In fact, I didn't like making the slightest physical effort. But I tried to keep a steady pace, wipe the sweat from my forehead, and ignore the burning in my legs. When I reached the twenty-fifth floor, Margo was waiting for me on the landing.
tr: “Biz birinci sınıftayken o son sınıftaydı,” diye cevap verdi. “Acele etmeliyiz, tamam mı? Vakit geçiyor.” Margo merdivenleri ikişer ikişer çıkmaya başladı, bir kolu tırabzanda yukarı doğru uçuyordu, ben de ona ayak uydurmaya çalıştım ama yapamadım. Margo herhangi bir spor yapmıyordu ama koşmayı severdi... Onu tek başına müzik dinleyerek Jefferson Park’ta koşarken birkaç kez görmüştüm. Ne var ki ben koşmayı ve hatta herhangi bir fiziksel eforla meşgul olmayı sevmiyordum. Ama şimdi, istikrarlı bir şekilde ona ayak uydurmaya çalışıyordum, almmdaki teri silerek ve bacaklarımdaki yanmayı görmezden gelerek. Yirmi beşinci kata ulaştığımda, Margo sahanlıkta durmuş beni bekliyordu.
tr_translation: “When we were in the first grade, he was in the final grade,” she replied. “We need to hurry, okay? Time is passing.” Margo started climbing the stairs two at a time, one arm flying up the banister, and I tried to keep up with her but couldn't. Margo didn't do any sports, but she loved to run... Her I had seen him a few times running in Jefferson Park, listening to music alone. However, I did not like running or even engaging in any physical effort. But now, I was trying to keep up with him steadily, wiping the sweat from my forehead and ignoring the burning in my legs. When I reached the twenty-fifth floor, Margo was standing on the landing, waiting for me.
vi: “Hồi chúng ta vào phổ thông thì anh ấy học năm cuối,” Margo đáp. “Phải nhanh lên mới được. Thời gian hao mòn lãng phí.” Cô ấy bắt đầu bước hai bậc một, lao người lên, một tay bám tay vịn cầu thang, tôi cố sức theo mà không kịp. Margo không chơi môn thể thao nào nhưng thích chạy bộ–thỉnh thoảng tôi vẫn thấy cô ấy vừa chạy một mình vừa nghe nhạc trong Công viên Jefferson. Cơ mà tôi lại không thích chạy. Hoặc vì thế mà không tham gia bất cứ loại vận động lao lực nào. Giờ tôi cố gắng giữ tốc độ ổn định, quệt mồ hôi túa ra trán và phớt lờ cơn đau thốn trong bắp chân. Khi tôi lên đến tầng hai mươi lăm, Margo đã đứng ở chiếu nghỉ đợi tôi.
vi_translation: “When we entered high school, he was in his final year,” Margo replied. “We need to hurry up.” “Time is wasting away.” She started taking the stairs two at a time, rushing up, one hand gripping the stair railing, and I struggled to keep up. Margo didn’t play any sports but liked to jog–I occasionally saw her running alone while listening to music in Jefferson Park. But I didn’t like running. Or maybe that’s why I didn’t participate in any strenuous physical activities. Now I tried to maintain a steady pace, wiping the sweat pouring down my forehead and ignoring the throbbing pain in my calves. When I reached the twenty-fifth floor, Margo was already standing at the landing, waiting for me.

en: “I’ll try not to take that personally,” I said. We were both staring into the inky distance, the cul-de-sacs and quarter-acre lots. But her shoulder was against my arm, and the backs of our hands were touching, and although I was not looking at Margo, pressing myself against the glass felt almost like pressing myself against her.
es: —Intentaré no tomármelo como algo personal —le dije. Nos quedamos los dos observando la oscura distancia, las calles sin salida y los terrenos de mil metros cuadrados. Pero Margo tenía el hombro pegado a mi brazo, los dorsos de nuestras manos se tocaban y, aunque no estaba mirándola, pegarme al cristal era casi como pegarme a ella.
es_translation: —I will try not to take it personally —I said to him. We both stayed watching the dark distance, the dead-end streets, and the thousand-square-meter plots. But Margo had her shoulder pressed against my arm, the backs of our hands touched, and although I wasn't looking at her, pressing against the glass was almost like pressing against her.
tr: “Bunu kişisel algılamamaya çalışacağım,” dedim, ikimiz de gözlerimizi dikmiş mürekkep gibi karanlığa, çıkmaz sokaklara ve çeyrek dönümlük bahçelere bakıyorduk. Ama Margo’nun omzu benim koluma dayalıydı ve ellerimizin üst kısımları birbirine değiyordu, Margo’ya bakmamama rağmen, cama yaslanmak neredeyse ona yaslanmakmış gibi hissettiriyordu.
tr_translation: “I will try not to take it personally,” I said, as we both stared into the ink-like darkness, dead-end streets, and quarter-acre gardens. But Margo's shoulder was leaning against my arm, and the tops of our hands were touching; even though I wasn't looking at Margo, leaning against the window felt almost like leaning against her.
vi: “Tớ sẽ cố gắng không nghĩ rằng cậu đang nói đến cá nhân cụ thể nào,” tôi nói. Chúng tôi cùng nhìn khoảng không hút mắt màu mực, những phố cụt và những lô đất làm nhà. Nhưng bờ vai cô ấy tì vào cánh tay tôi, mu bàn tay chúng tôi chạm nhau, và dù tôi không nhìn Margo, nhưng áp mặt vào cửa kính cũng khiến tôi cảm thấy gần như đang áp mặt vào cô ấy.
vi_translation: “I'll try not to think that you're talking about any specific person,” I said. We both looked at the ink-colored void, the dead-end streets, and the plots of land for houses. But her shoulder pressed against my arm, the backs of our hands touched, and even though I wasn't looking at Margo, pressing my face against the glass made me feel almost as if I were pressing my face against hers.

en: “Yeah. It’s all good,” I said, but remembering the godforsaken Crown School of Dance pissed me off, and I said, “Yeah. Chuck Parson. You know where he lives?”
es: —Bueno, no pasa nada —le dije, pero recordar la dichosa Escuela de Baile Crown me tocó las narices, así que añadí—: Sí. Chuck Parson. ¿Sabes dónde vive?
es_translation: —Well, it's no big deal —I said to him, but remembering the darn Crown Dance School got on my nerves, so I added—: Yes. Chuck Parson. Do you know where he lives?
tr: “Evet. Hiç önemli değil,” dedim ama kahrolası Crown Dans Okulu’nu hatırlamak beni kızdırdı. “Evet. Chuck Parson. Nerede oturduğunu biliyor musun?” diye sordum.
tr_translation: “Yes. It's not important at all,” I said, but remembering the damn Crown Dance School made me angry. “Yes. Chuck Parson. Do you know where he lives?” I asked.
vi: “Ờ, không sao đâu,” tôi nói, nhưng thực ra trong bụng vẫn ôm cái vố nhớ đời ở trường vũ đạo Crown. “Được. Chuck Parson. Cậu biết nhà nó không?”
vi_translation: "Oh, it's okay," I said, but in reality, I was still holding onto the unforgettable incident at Crown Dance School. "Alright. Chuck Parson. Do you know where he lives?"

en: We were walking away from the car together when Margo reached down for my hand, laced her fingers in mine, and squeezed. I squeezed back and then glanced at her. She nodded her head solemnly, and I nodded back, and then she let go of my hand. We scampered up to the window. I gently pushed the wooden casing up. It squeaked ever so quietly but opened in one motion. I looked in. It was dark, but I could see a body in a bed.
es: Nos alejábamos del coche cuando Margo me cogió de la mano, entrelazó sus dedos con los míos y los apretó. Le devolví el apretón y la miré. Movió la cabeza solemnemente, volví a apretar y me soltó la mano. Corrimos hasta la ventana. Empujé hacia arriba despacio el marco de madera. Chirrió un poco, pero se abrió a la primera. Eché un vistazo. Aunque estaba oscuro, vi a alguien en una cama.
es_translation: We were walking away from the car when Margo took my hand, intertwined her fingers with mine, and squeezed. I squeezed back and looked at her. She nodded solemnly, I squeezed again, and she let go of my hand. We ran to the window. I slowly pushed the wooden frame up. It creaked a little, but it opened on the first try. I took a look inside. Although it was dark, I saw someone on a bed.
tr: Margo elime uzanıp parmaklarım benimkilere geçirerek sıktığında, birlikte arabadan uzaklaşıyorduk. Ben de onunkileri sıkıp ona baktım. Ciddiyetle başını salladı, ben de ona salladım ve sonra elimi bıraktı. Çabucak pencereye çıktık. Tahta çerçeveyi usulca yukarı ittim. Çok az gıcırdadı ama tek bir hareketle açıldı. İçeri baktım. Karanlıktı fakat yatakta birinin olduğunu görebiliyordum.
tr_translation: When Margo reached out and intertwined her fingers with mine, we were walking away from the car together. I squeezed hers and looked at her. She nodded seriously, I nodded back, and then she let go of my hand. We quickly climbed out the window. I gently pushed the wooden frame up. It creaked very little but opened in one motion. I looked inside. It was dark, but I could see someone in the bed.
vi: Chúng tôi ra khỏi xe và đi bộ cạnh nhau, Margo đưa tay ra nắm tay tôi, đan những ngón tay cô ấy vào các ngón tay tôi, và siết chặt. Tôi cũng siết tay mình và liếc nhìn cô ấy. Margo lặng lẽ gật đầu, tôi gật đầu đáp lại, và cô ấy thả tay tôi ra. Chúng tôi lẹ làng đến trước cửa sổ. Tôi khẽ đẩy khung gỗ lên. Hơi khẽ phát ra tiếng động, nhưng mở được ngay. Tôi nhìn vào trong. Tối quá, nhưng tôi thấy một người nằm trên giường.
vi_translation: We got out of the car and walked side by side, Margo reached out and held my hand, intertwining her fingers with mine, and squeezed tightly. I also squeezed my hand and glanced at her. Margo quietly nodded, I nodded back, and she released my hand. We quickly approached the window. I gently pushed the wooden frame up. It made a slight noise, but it opened right away. I looked inside. It was too dark, but I saw someone lying on the bed.

en: The window was a little high for Margo, so I put my hands together and she stepped a socked foot onto my hand and I boosted her up. Her silent entrance into the house would have made a ninja jealous. I proceeded to jump up, get my head and shoulders into the window, and then attempt, via a complicated torso undulation, to dance the caterpillar into the house. That might have worked fine except I racked my balls against the windowsill, which hurt so bad that I groaned, which was a pretty sizable mistake.
es: Como la ventana estaba un poco alta para Margo, junté las manos, puso un pie encima y la impulsé. Su silenciosa entrada en la casa habría sido la envidia de un ninja. Me dispuse a subir, metí la cabeza y los hombros por la ventana, y pretendía, mediante una complicada contorsión, entrar en la casa en plan oruga. Podría haber funcionado perfectamente de no haberme aplastado los huevos contra la repisa, y me dolió tanto que solté un quejido, lo cual suponía un error nada desdeñable.
es_translation: Since the window was a bit high for Margo, I cupped my hands, she put a foot on them, and I boosted her up. Her silent entry into the house would have been the envy of a ninja. I prepared to climb up, stuck my head and shoulders through the window, and intended, through a complicated contortion, to enter the house caterpillar-style. It could have worked perfectly if I hadn't crushed my balls against the ledge, and it hurt so much that I let out a groan, which was no small mistake.
tr: Pencere Margo için biraz yüksekti, bu yüzden ellerimi birleştirdim, Margo çoraplı ayağıyla elimin üstüne bastı ve onu yukarı doğru ittim. Sessizce eve girişi bir ninjayı kıskandınrdı. Bense yukan zıplayıp başımı ve omuzlarımı pencereye ulaştırmaya, karmaşık bir vücut dalgalanması yoluyla, tırtıl gibi dans ederek evin içine girmeye çalıştım. Her şey iyi gitmiş olabilirdi, yalnız hayalarım pencere eşiğine takıldı ve acıdan inledim ki bu oldukça büyük bir hataydı.
tr_translation: The window was a bit high for Margo, so I clasped my hands together, Margo stepped on my hand with her socked foot, and I pushed her up. Her silent entry into the house would make a ninja envious. As for me, I tried to jump up and get my head and shoulders to the window, attempting to enter the house by performing a complex body undulation, dancing like a caterpillar. Everything might have gone well, except my groin got caught on the window sill and I groaned in pain, which was quite a big mistake.
vi: Cửa sổ hơi cao so với Margo, nên tôi chắp tay để cô ấy dận một chân đi bít tất lên, và tôi đẩy Margo lên. Cô ấy vào trong êm ái đến mức ninja thứ thiệt chắc cũng phải ghen tị. Tôi nhảy lên, chui được đầu và vai qua cửa sổ, rồi với nỗ lực xoắn vặn cơ thể, tôi uốn éo như sâu lùn chùn bò vào trong. Sự thể lẽ ra đã suôn sẻ, nếu tôi không lỡ cọ hai quả trứng cò vào bậu cửa sổ, đau tê tái đến mức tôi không nén nổi rên rẩm, gây ra một sai lầm vô cùng tệ hại.
vi_translation: The window was a bit high for Margo, so I clasped my hands for her to step on with one socked foot, and I pushed Margo up. She got in so smoothly that even a real ninja would be envious. I jumped up, got my head and shoulders through the window, and with a twisting effort, I wriggled like a worm to get inside. Things would have gone smoothly if I hadn't accidentally brushed my two eggs against the window sill, causing such excruciating pain that I couldn't help but groan, leading to a terribly bad mistake.

en: A bedside light came on. And there, lying in bed, was some old guy—decidedly not Chuck Parson. His eyes were wide with terror; he didn’t say a thing.
es: Se encendió la luz de la mesita. Y resultó que el que estaba en la cama era un viejo, sin duda no era Chuck Parson. Abrió los ojos como platos, aterrorizado. No dijo una palabra.
es_translation: The light on the bedside table turned on. And it turned out that the one in the bed was an old man, certainly not Chuck Parson. He opened his eyes wide, terrified. He didn't say a word.
tr: Bir başucu lambası yandı. Ve orada, yatakta yatan, yaşlı bir adamdı... açık bir şekilde Chuck Parson değildi. Gözleri dehşetle açılmıştı; hiçbir şey söylemedi.
tr_translation: A bedside lamp turned on. And there, lying in bed, was an old man... it was clearly not Chuck Parson. His eyes were wide with terror; he said nothing.
vi: Đèn ở đầu giường bật sáng. Người nằm trên giường là một bác trai có tuổi–rõ ràng không phải Chuck Parson. Bác ta tròn mắt kinh hãi và không nói nổi lời nào.
vi_translation: The bedside lamp turned on. The person lying on the bed was an elderly man—clearly not Chuck Parson. He widened his eyes in horror and couldn't utter a word.

en: “Yeah, yeah, I just did it. I was doing it while saying no—can’t help but help. Four-two-two Amherst. Hey, why do you want Chuck Parson’s address at four-twelve in the morning?”
es: —Sí, sí. Ya está. Estaba entrando mientras te decía que no… No puedo evitar ayudarte. Amherst, 422. Oye, ¿para qué necesitas la dirección de Chuck Parson a las cuatro y doce de la mañana?
es_translation: —Yes, yes. It's done. I was coming in while I was telling you no... I can't help but assist you. Amherst, 422. Hey, why do you need Chuck Parson's address at four twelve in the morning?
tr: “Evet evet, az önce yaptım. Hayır derken yapıyordum, yardım etmekten başka çarem yok. 422 Amherst. Hey, sabahın dört buçuğunda neden Chuck Parson’m adresini istiyorsun?
tr_translation: “Yes, yes, I just did it. I was doing it while saying no, I have no choice but to help. 422 Amherst. Hey, why are you asking for Chuck Parson’s address at four-thirty in the morning?”
vi: “Rồi rồi, làm xong rồi đó. Tôi đã làm trong khi nói không rồi đó–không thể làm gì ngoài giúp đỡ há. Bốn-hai-hai Amherst. Này, thế quái nào mà ông lại cần địa chỉ của Chuck Parson vào lúc bốn giờ mười hai phút sáng vậy?”
vi_translation: “Alright, alright, it's done. I did it while saying no–can't do anything but help, huh. Four-two-two Amherst. Hey, why the heck do you need the address of Chuck Parson at twelve minutes past four in the morning?

en: Margo glanced at her watch and held up two fingers. We waited. And for those two minutes we just stared at each other, and I watched the blue in her eyes. It was nice—in the dark and the quiet, with no possibility of me saying anything to screw it up, and her eyes looking back, like there was something in me worth seeing.
es: Margo echó un vistazo a su reloj y levantó dos dedos. Esperamos. Y durante dos minutos nos quedamos mirándonos. Yo observé el azul de sus ojos. Fue bonito. A oscuras y en silencio, sin la posibilidad de que yo dijera algo y metiera la pata, y ella me devolvía la mirada, como si hubiera algo en mí que merecía la pena ver.
es_translation: Margo glanced at her watch and raised two fingers. We waited. And for two minutes we just stared at each other. I observed the blue of her eyes. It was beautiful. In the dark and in silence, without the possibility of me saying something and messing it up, and she returned my gaze, as if there was something in me worth seeing.
tr: Margo saatine bir göz attı ve iki parmağını yukarı kaldırdı. Bekledik. O iki dakika boyunca sadece birbirimize gözlerimizi dikip baktık ve ben onun gözlerindeki maviliği izledim. Çok hoştu... karanlık ve sessizlik, her şeyi mahvedecek bir şey söyleme ihtimalim olmadan. Ve onun gözleri de bana bakıyordu, sanki bende görmeye değer bir şey varmış gibi.
tr_translation: Margo glanced at her watch and raised two fingers. We waited. During those two minutes, we just stared into each other's eyes, and I watched the blueness in her eyes. It was very nice... darkness and silence, without the possibility of me saying something that would ruin everything. And her eyes were looking at me too, as if there was something worth seeing in me.
vi: Margo liếc đồng hồ và giơ hai ngón tay lên. Chúng tôi đợi. Trong hai phút ấy hai đứa chỉ nhìn nhau, và tôi nhìn màu xanh trong mắt cô ấy. Thật tuyệt–trong bóng tối và không gian yên tĩnh, không có nguy cơ tôi sẽ vạ miệng nói lung tung làm hỏng khung cảnh, và đôi mắt cô ấy nhìn lại tôi, như thể có gì đó ở tôi đáng được nhìn vậy.
vi_translation: Margo glanced at the clock and raised two fingers. We waited. During those two minutes, we just looked at each other, and I gazed into the blue of her eyes. It was wonderful—in the darkness and quiet space, there was no risk of me saying something foolish to ruin the moment, and her eyes looked back at me, as if there was something in me worth looking at.

en: “You’re just a really loud, awkward ninja,” Margo said, “but we are both ninjas.” She tucked her hair behind her ears, pulled up her hood, and scrunched it shut with a drawstring; the streetlight lit up the sharp features of her pale face. Maybe we were both ninjas, but only she had the outfit.
es: —Los dos somos ninjas, solo que tú eres un ninja torpe y ruidoso —dijo Margo. Se colocó el pelo detrás de las orejas, se puso la capucha y se la ató con el cordón. La farola iluminó los agudos rasgos de su cara pálida. Quizá los dos éramos ninjas, pero solo ella lo parecía.
es_translation: —We are both ninjas, only you are a clumsy and noisy ninja —said Margo. She tucked her hair behind her ears, put on the hood, and tied it with the cord. The streetlamp illuminated the sharp features of her pale face. Maybe we were both ninjas, but only she looked like one.
tr: “Sen sadece gerçekten gürültücü, sakar bir ninjasın,” dedi Margo, “ama ikimiz de ninjayız.” Saçını kulaklarının arkasına attı; kapüşonunu başma çekip ipiyle hışırdatarak büzdü; sokak lambası solgun yüzünün keskin hatlarını aydınlatıyordu. Belki ikimiz de ninjaydık fakat ekipmanı olan yalnızca oydu.

Maybe we were both ninjas, but she was the only one with equipment.

Everything beautiful is locked up. Most of the animals are put in different pools at night." She turned her head and looked at SeaWorld as if appraising it. "I guess the fun isn't in being inside."
vi: Margo không đáp. Cô ấy nhìn xa xôi, hai mắt nhíu lại gần như nhắm. “Tớ cảm thấy lần này giống hệt hồi vào trong phim trường của hãng Universal,” lát sau Margo nói. “Chỗ này cũng hay hay, đại loại thế, nhưng chẳng có gì xem được nữa. Các loại xe trượt cảm giác mạnh không hoạt động. Những thứ hay ho đều bị khóa lại cả rồi. Buổi đêm đa phần các con vật đều bị nhốt trong các lồng bể khác nhau.” Margo quay đầu lại và nhận xét về SeaWorld mà chúng tôi đang chứng kiến. “Tớ nghĩ phần lí thú không phải là được đứng ở đây.”
vi_translation: Margo did not respond. She looked distant, her eyes squinted almost shut. "I feel like this time is exactly like when we went into the Universal Studios set," Margo said after a while. "This place is kind of cool, something like that, but there's nothing left to see. The thrill rides aren't operating. The interesting things are all locked up. At night, most of the animals are locked in different tanks." Margo turned her head and commented about the SeaWorld we were witnessing. "I think the fun part isn't about standing here."

en: A normal mother might have said, “Hey, I notice you look like you’re coming down off a meth binge and smell vaguely of algae. Were you perchance dancing with a snakebit Margo Roth Spiegelman a couple hours ago?” But no. They preferred dreams.
es: Una madre normal podría haber dicho: «Oye, tienes pinta de estar de bajón después de haberte pegado un atracón de metanfetaminas y hueles a algo parecido a algas. ¿Por casualidad hace un par de horas estabas bailando con Margo Roth Spiegelman, a la que acababa de morder una serpiente?». Pero no. Mis padres preferían los sueños.
es_translation: A normal mother might have said, "Hey, you look like you're feeling down after bingeing on methamphetamines and you smell like something similar to seaweed. By any chance, were you dancing with Margo Roth Spiegelman a couple of hours ago, who had just been bitten by a snake?" But no. My parents preferred dreams.
tr: Normal bir anne şöyle diyebilirdi: “Hey, esrar âleminden dönmüş gibi görünüyorsun ve belli belirsiz yosun kokuyorsun. Birkaç saat önce bir ihtimal yılan tarafından sokulmuş Margo Roth Spiegelman’la dans etmiş olabilir inisin?” Ama hayır. Rüyaları tercih ediyorlardı.
tr_translation: A normal mother might have said: "Hey, you look like you've returned from a weed trip and you faintly smell of seaweed. Is it possible that a few hours ago you danced with Margo Roth Spiegelman, who might have been bitten by a snake?” But no. They preferred dreams.
vi: Một người mẹ bình thường chắc sẽ nói, “Này, mẹ phát hiện ra rồi nhé, trông con như vừa say chất kích thích thế kia, lại còn tanh tanh mùi bùn rêu. Có phải mấy tiếng trước con vừa nhảy với con bé Margo Roth Spiegelman bị rắn cắn không?” Nhưng không. Bố mẹ tôi thích bàn chuyện những giấc mơ hơn.
vi_translation: A typical mother would probably say, "Hey, I found out, you look like you're high on something, and you smell like mud and algae. Did you just dance with that girl Margo Roth Spiegelman who got bitten by a snake a few hours ago?" But no. My parents prefer to talk about dreams.

en: I walked to the bathroom, splashed water on my face, and then leaned over the sink, close to the mirror, and appraised myself. I tried to rub the bloodshotedness out of my eyes, but I couldn’t. And then I had a brilliant idea. I went into a stall, put the seat down, sat down, leaned against the side, and fell asleep. The sleep lasted for about sixteen milliseconds before the second period bell rang. I got up and walked to Latin, and then to physics, and then finally it was fourth period, and I found Ben in the cafeteria and said, “I really need a nap or something.”
es: Me dirigí al baño, me eché agua en la cara, me acerqué al espejo por encima del lavabo y me observé. Me froté los ojos para eliminar la rojez, pero no pude. Y entonces se me ocurrió una idea brillante. Entré en un retrete, bajé la tapa, me senté, me apoyé en la pared y me quedé dormido. El sueño duró unos dieciséis milisegundos, hasta que sonó el timbre de la segunda hora. Me levanté y me dirigí a clase de latín, luego a física y por fin llegó la hora de comer. Encontré a Ben en la cafetería. —Necesito una siesta —le dije.
es_translation: I went to the bathroom, splashed water on my face, approached the mirror above the sink, and observed myself. I rubbed my eyes to eliminate the redness, but I couldn't. And then a brilliant idea occurred to me. I entered a stall, lowered the lid, sat down, leaned against the wall, and fell asleep. The sleep lasted about sixteen milliseconds, until the bell for the second period rang. I got up and went to Latin class, then to physics, and finally it was lunchtime. I found Ben in the cafeteria. —I need a nap —I told him.
tr: Tuvalete gidip yüzüme su çarptım, sonra lavabonun üstüne eğilip aynaya yanaştım ve kendimi inceledim. Kanlanmış gözlerimi ovuşturarak düzeltmeye çalıştım ama yapamadım. Sonra aklıma harika bir fikir geldi. Tuvaletlerden birine girdim, klozet kapağını kapatıp oturdum, yan tarafa dayandım ve uykuya daldım, ikinci ders zili çalmadan önce yaklaşık on altı milisaniye uyuyabilmiştim. Kalkıp Latince dersine, sonra fiziğe girdim, ardından nihayet teneffüs geldi, Ben’i kafeteryada buldum ve “Gerçekten kısa bir uykuya ihtiyacım var,” dedim.
tr_translation: I went to the bathroom and splashed water on my face, then leaned over the sink, approached the mirror, and examined myself. I tried to fix my bloodshot eyes by rubbing them, but I couldn't. Then a great idea came to my mind. I entered one of the stalls, closed the toilet lid, sat down, leaned to the side, and fell asleep; I managed to sleep for about sixteen milliseconds before the second bell rang. I got up and went to Latin class, then physics, and finally, the break came. I found Ben in the cafeteria and said, "I really need a short nap."
vi: Tôi vào nhà vệ sinh, vã nước lên mặt, rồi tì lên bồn rửa, ghé sát vào gương, săm soi mặt mình. Tôi cố dụi hai con mắt đỏ ngầu mà chẳng thấy đỡ chút nào. Và rồi tôi nảy ra một ý tưởng hết xảy. Tôi vào một ngăn vệ sinh, đậy nắp bồn cầu xuống, ngồi lên, dựa vào vách, và ngủ. Giấc ngủ kéo dài khoảng mười sáu mili giây thì chuông báo tiết hai reo. Tôi đứng dậy đi vào lớp học giờ tiếng La-tinh, rồi vật lí. Rút cục cũng đến tiết bốn, tôi vớ được Ben trong căng-tin và nói, “Tôi thực sự cần chợp mắt một lúc hoặc đại loại thế.”
vi_translation: I went into the bathroom, splashed water on my face, then leaned on the sink, got close to the mirror, and scrutinized my face. I tried rubbing my bloodshot eyes but it didn't help at all. And then I came up with a brilliant idea. I went into a stall, closed the toilet lid, sat on it, leaned against the wall, and slept. The sleep lasted about sixteen milliseconds before the bell for the second period rang. I got up and went to Latin class, then physics. Finally, it was the fourth period, I caught up with Ben in the cafeteria and said, “I really need to take a nap or something.”

en: That night, I lay on my side, staring out the window into the invisible world outside. I kept trying to fall asleep, but then my eyes would dart open, just to check. I couldn’t help but hope that Margo Roth Spiegelman would return to my window and drag my tired ass through one more night I’d never forget.
es: Aquella noche me tumbé de lado en mi cama y observé el invisible mundo al otro lado de la ventana. Intentaba dormirme, pero los ojos se me abrían cada dos por tres para controlar. No podía evitar esperar que Margo Roth Spiegelman volviera a mi ventana y arrastrara mi cansado culo por otra noche inolvidable.
es_translation: That night I lay on my side in bed and observed the invisible world on the other side of the window. I tried to fall asleep, but my eyes kept opening every so often to check. I couldn't help but hope that Margo Roth Spiegelman would come back to my window and drag my tired ass through another unforgettable night.
tr: O gece yan yatıp pencereden, dışarıdaki görünmeyen dünyaya baktım. Uyumaya çalıştım ama gözlerim sürekli açıldı... sadece kontrol etmek için. Margo Roth Spiegelman’m pencereme dönüp yorgun kıçımı asla unutamayacağım bir geceye daha sürüklemesini ummaktan başka bir şey yapamıyordum.
tr_translation: That night, I lay on my side and looked out the window at the invisible world outside. I tried to sleep, but my eyes kept opening... just to check. All I could do was hope that Margo Roth Spiegelman would turn up at my window and drag my tired ass into another night I would never forget.
vi: Đêm đó, tôi nằm nghiêng, dõi qua cửa sổ nhìn vào thế giới vô hình bên ngoài. Tôi ráng ngủ, nhưng rồi hai mắt lại mở trừng, chỉ để kiểm tra. Tôi không khỏi phấp phỏng hi vọng rằng Margo Roth Spiegelman sẽ quay lại bên cửa sổ và kéo lê cái mông mệt xụi lơ của tôi phiêu lưu thêm một đêm tôi sẽ không thể nào quên.
vi_translation: That night, I lay on my side, gazing out the window into the invisible world outside. I tried to sleep, but then my eyes would snap open, just to check. I couldn't help but hope that Margo Roth Spiegelman would come back to the window and drag my exhausted self on another unforgettable adventure.

en: I shook my head again, and then joined the silence. We couldn’t turn them in; we’d tried that plenty in middle school, and it inevitably resulted in more punishment. Usually, we’d just have to wait until someone like Margo reminded everyone what immature jackasses they all were.
es: Volví a menear la cabeza y yo también me quedé en silencio. No podíamos denunciarlos. Lo habíamos intentado muchas veces antes del instituto, y el resultado inevitable había sido que nos acosaran todavía más. En general solo podíamos esperar a que alguien como Margo les recordara lo inmaduros y gilipollas que eran.
es_translation: I shook my head again and I too remained silent. We couldn't report them. We had tried many times before high school, and the inevitable result had been that they bullied us even more. In general, we could only hope that someone like Margo would remind them how immature and idiotic they were.
tr: Tekrar başımı salladım, sonra sessizliğe katıldım. Onları şikâyet edemezdik; ortaokulda pek çok kez denemiştik ve kaçınılmaz olarak daha fazla cezayla sonuçlanmıştı. Genellikle Margo gibi birinin herkese nasıl olgunlaşmamış ahmaklar olduklarını hatırlatmasını beklemek zorundaydık.
tr_translation: I nodded my head again, then joined the silence. We couldn't complain about them; we had tried many times in middle school and it had inevitably resulted in more punishment. We usually had to rely on someone like Margo to remind everyone how immature fools they were.
vi: Tôi lại lắc đầu rồi hòa cùng im lặng với chúng nó. Tụi tôi không thể xì những thằng ấy ra được; hồi học trung học cơ sở chúng tôi đã nhiều lần cố gắng làm vậy và hệ quả tất yếu là hình phạt dành cho chúng tôi càng chồng chất hơn. Thường bọn tôi sẽ đợi cho đến khi ai đó như Margo nhắc nhở chúng rằng chúng rặt là một đám ngốc nghếch dại dột ra sao.
vi_translation: I shook my head again and joined the silence with them. We couldn't expose those guys; back in middle school, we had tried many times, and the inevitable consequence was that the punishments for us kept piling up. Usually, we would wait until someone like Margo reminded them of how utterly foolish and stupid they were.

en: But Margo had given me a way of starting a counteroffensive. And I was just about to say something when, in my peripheral vision, I saw a large individual running toward us at a full sprint. He wore a black ski mask and carried a large, complex green water cannon. As he ran past he tagged me on the shoulder and I lost my footing, landing against the cracked concrete on my left side. As he reached the door, he turned back and shouted toward me, “You screw with us and you’re gonna get smackdown.” The voice was not familiar to me.
es: Pero Margo me había enseñado un modo de iniciar la contraofensiva. Y estaba a punto de decir algo cuando vi de reojo a un tipo alto corriendo hacia nosotros. Llevaba un pasamontañas negro y un sofisticado cañón de agua de color verde en las manos. Al pasar me dio un golpe en el hombro, perdí el equilibrio y aterricé de lado en el cemento agrietado. Al llegar a la puerta, se giró y me gritó: —Te dedicas a putearnos, así que te vamos a empalizar. La voz no me sonaba de nada.
es_translation: But Margo had taught me a way to start the counteroffensive. And I was about to say something when I saw out of the corner of my eye a tall guy running towards us. He was wearing a black ski mask and holding a sophisticated green water cannon in his hands. As he passed, he hit me on the shoulder, I lost my balance and landed on my side on the cracked cement. When he reached the door, he turned and shouted at me: —You dedicate yourself to screwing us over, so we're going to impale you. The voice didn't sound familiar to me at all.
tr: Ama Margo bana bir karşı saldın başlatma yolu vermişti. Bize doğru son hızla koşan cüsseli birisini göz ucuyla gördüğümde tam bir şey söylemek üzereydim. Siyah bir kar maskesi giyiyor ve geniş, yeşil bir tazyikli su tabancası taşıyordu. Beni koşarak geçerken omzuma çarptı, dengemi kaybederek sol tarafımın üstüne, çatlak betona düştüm. Kapıya ulaştığında, geri dönüp bana bağırdı: “Bizimle dalga geçersen hezimeti alırsın.” Ses tanıdık değildi.
tr_translation: Ama Margo had given me a way to initiate a counterattack. I was just about to say something when I saw, out of the corner of my eye, a burly figure running towards us at full speed. He was wearing a black ski mask and carrying a large, green water gun. As he ran past me, he bumped into my shoulder, causing me to lose my balance and fall onto my left side on the cracked concrete. When he reached the door, he turned back and shouted at me: "If you mess with us, you'll face defeat." The voice was not familiar.
vi: Nhưng Margo đã vén màn cho tôi thấy cách chống trả những trò ma cũ bắt nạt ma mới, ỷ mạnh hiếp yếu ấy. Tôi toan nói thì chợt lé mắt thấy một vóc người to lớn đang huỳnh huỵch chạy hết tốc lực về phía chúng tôi. Hắn đeo mặt nạ trượt tuyết màu đen và cắp theo cây súng phun nước xanh lục to đùng hầm hố. Khi vụt qua, hắn huých phải vai tôi khiến tôi mất thăng bằng, ngã nghiêng người xuống nền bê-tông thô ráp. “Mày chơi bọn ông thì mày sẽ bị được dính chưởng.” Tôi không nhận ra được là giọng đứa nào.
vi_translation: But Margo had unveiled to me how to resist those old tricks of bullying the newcomers, the strong preying on the weak. I was about to speak when I suddenly caught sight of a large figure running at full speed towards us. He was wearing a black ski mask and carrying a huge, menacing green water gun. As he rushed past, he bumped into my shoulder, causing me to lose my balance and fall sideways onto the rough concrete. "If you mess with us, you'll get what's coming to you." I couldn't recognize whose voice it was.

en: Look, Quentin, and yeah, I know it’s you. You know it wasn’t me who squirt-peed those freshmen. I’m sorry, but it’s not like I control the actions of other people.
es: Mira, Quentin, porque sí, sé que eres tú. Sabes que no fui yo el que chorreó con meados a los chicos de primero. Lo siento, pero no controlo lo que hacen los demás.
es_translation: Look, Quentin, because yes, I know it's you. You know it wasn't me who sprayed the first-year kids with pee. I'm sorry, but I can't control what others do.
tr: Bak, Quentin, ve evet bunun sen olduğunu biliyorum. O birinci sınıflara çiş fışkırtan ben değilim, biliyorsun. Üzgünüm ama diğer insanların hareketlerini kontrol falan edemiyorum.
tr_translation: Look, Quentin, and yes, I know this is you. I'm not the one spraying pee on the freshmen, you know that. Sorry, but I can't control other people's actions or anything.
vi: Nghe đây Quentin, phải, tao biết là mày. Mày biết không phải tao tiểu phun bọn lính mới. Rất tiếc, nhưng tao không kiểm soát hành động của những đứa khác được.
vi_translation: Listen here Quentin, yes, I know it's you. You know it wasn't me who sprayed the new soldiers. Sorry, but I can't control the actions of others.

en: I liked the image of Margo as a balloon, but I figured that in his urge for the poetic, the detective had seen more worry in me than the pang I’d actually felt. I knew she’d be back. She’d deflate and float back to Jefferson Park. She always had.
es: Me gustó la imagen de Margo como un globo, pero pensé que, en su deseo de ser poético, el detective me había visto mucho más preocupado de lo que realmente estaba. Sabía que volvería. Se desinflaría y volvería volando a Jefferson Park. Siempre había vuelto.
es_translation: I liked the image of Margo as a balloon, but I thought that, in his desire to be poetic, the detective had seen me as much more worried than I actually was. I knew she would come back. She would deflate and fly back to Jefferson Park. She had always come back.
tr: Margo’nun balon halini hayal etmek hoşuma gitmişti ama dedektif konuya şiirsel yaklaşırken bende, aslında hissettiğim ani sancıdan ziyade endişe gördüğünü düşündüm. Margo’nun geri döneceğini biliyordum. Sönecek ve tekrar Jefiferson Park’a doğru süzülecekti. Her zaman öyle yapmıştı.
tr_translation: I liked imagining Margo as a balloon, but while the detective approached the matter poetically, I thought he saw worry in me rather than the sudden pang I actually felt. I knew Margo would come back. She would deflate and float back towards Jefferson Park. She had always done so.
vi: Tôi thích hình dung Margo như quả bóng bay, nhưng dường như trong cơn trào dâng đầy chất thơ vừa rồi, vị thám tử đã nhìn thấu có rất nhiều lo lắng ở trong tôi, còn hơn cả những xung động tôi đang thực sự cảm nhận. Tôi biết Margo sẽ về. Cô ấy sẽ xẹp lại và trôi trở về Jefferson Park. Cô ấy luôn như vậy.
vi_translation: I like to imagine Margo as a balloon, but it seems that in the midst of the poetic surge just now, the detective saw through to a lot of worries within me, even more than the impulses I was actually feeling. I know Margo will come back. She will deflate and drift back to Jefferson Park. She always does.

en: “I would think that she’d be back by Monday,” I said. “You don’t want to miss too much school, even if you’re Margo Roth Spiegelman. Maybe she can stay here till graduation.”
es: —Diría que volverá el lunes —comenté—. Ni siquiera a Margo Roth Spiegelman le interesa perder muchas clases. Quizá se quede aquí hasta la graduación.
es_translation: —I would say she will be back on Monday —I commented—. Not even Margo Roth Spiegelman is interested in missing too many classes. Maybe she will stay here until graduation.
tr: “Pazartesiye kadar dönmüş olacağını düşünüyorum,” dedim. “Dersleri fazla ekmek istemezsin, Margo Roth Spiegelman olsan bile. Belki mezuniyete kadar burada kalabilir.
tr_translation: “I think you will have returned by Monday,” I said. “You wouldn't want to skip too many classes, even if you were Margo Roth Spiegelman. Maybe you could stay here until graduation.”
vi: “Tôi nghĩ có lẽ đến thứ Hai Margo sẽ về,” tôi nói. “Có ai muốn nghỉ học vô độ đâu, dù là Margo Roth Spiegelman đi nữa. Có lẽ cậu ấy có thể ở đây cho đến lúc tốt nghiệp.”
vi_translation: “I think maybe Margo will be back by Monday,” I said. “No one wants to skip school indefinitely, not even Margo Roth Spiegelman. Maybe she can stay here until graduation.”

en: I shrugged my shoulders. I didn’t know the answer, but of course I had my hopes: maybe Margo needed to see my confidence. Maybe this time she wanted to be found, and to be found by me. Maybe—just as she had chosen me on the longest night, she had chosen me again. And maybe untold riches awaited he who found her.
es: Me encogí de hombros. No podía responderle, aunque por supuesto albergaba esperanzas: quizá Margo quería ver que confiaba en mí mismo. Quizá esa vez quería que la encontraran, que la encontrara yo. Quizá… igual que me había elegido a mí para la noche más larga, había vuelto a elegirme a mí. Y quizá al que la encontrara le esperasen incalculables riquezas.
es_translation: I shrugged. I couldn't answer him, although of course I harbored hopes: maybe Margo wanted to see that I trusted myself. Maybe this time she wanted to be found, for me to find her. Maybe... just as she had chosen me for the longest night, she had chosen me again. And maybe incalculable riches awaited the one who found her.
tr: Omzumu silktim. Cevabı bilmiyordum ama elbette umutlarım vardı: Belki Margo’nun benim güvenimi görmesi gerekiyordu. Belki bu sefer benim tarafımdan bulunmak istiyordu. Belki... tam da o uzun gecede beni seçtiği gibi, yine beni seçmişti. Ve belki onu bulan kişiyi bilinmeyen hazineler bekliyordu.
tr_translation: I shrugged. I didn't know the answer, but of course, I had hopes: Maybe Margo needed to see my trust. Maybe this time she wanted to be found by me. Maybe... just as she chose me on that long night, she had chosen me again. And maybe unknown treasures awaited the person who found her.
vi: Tôi nhún vai. Tôi không có câu trả lời, nhưng tất nhiên tôi nuôi hi vọng: có lẽ Margo muốn thấy sự tự tin của tôi. Có thể lần này cô ấy muốn được tìm thấy, và được tôi tìm thấy. Có thể–cũng giống như cô ấy đã chọn tôi trong cái đêm dài nhất ấy, lần này cô ấy lại chọn tôi. Và có thể kho báu bí mật đang chờ người tìm ra cô ấy.
vi_translation: I shrugged. I didn't have an answer, but of course, I held onto hope: maybe Margo wanted to see my confidence. Maybe this time she wanted to be found, and found by me. Maybe—just like she chose me on that longest night, this time she chose me again. And maybe the secret treasure is waiting for someone to find her.

en: I knew these halls so well—and finally it was starting to feel like they knew me, too. I stood there as the third bell rang and the crowds dwindled. Only then did I walk to calc, sitting down just after Mr. Jiminez had started another interminable lecture.
es: Conocía muy bien aquellos pasillos y al final empezaba a parecer que también ellos me conocían a mí. Me quedé allí parado mientras sonaba el tercer timbre y la multitud se dispersaba. Solo entonces me dirigí a la clase de cálculo y me senté justo después de que el señor Jiminez hubiera empezado otra de sus interminables lecciones.
es_translation: I knew those hallways very well, and in the end, it started to seem like they knew me too. I stood there while the third bell rang and the crowd dispersed. Only then did I head to calculus class and sit down just after Mr. Jiminez had started another of his endless lessons.

tr: Bu koridorları o kadar iyi tanıyordum ki... ve sonunda onlar da beni tanıyorlarmış gibi gelmeye başhyordu. Üçüncü zil çaldığında kalabalık git gide azalırken orada durdum. Ancak daha sonra matematiğe girdim ve Bay Jiminez başka bir bitmek bilmez derse başladıktan hemen sonra yerime oturdum.
tr_translation: I knew these corridors so well... and eventually, it felt like they were starting to know me too. I stood there as the crowd gradually thinned out when the third bell rang. But later I entered math class and sat down in my seat right after Mr. Jiminez started another endless lesson.
vi: Tôi quá biết những hành lang này–và rút cục cũng bắt đầu có cảm giác rằng chúng biết tôi. Tôi vẫn đứng đó khi hồi chuông thứ ba vang lên và đám đông bắt đầu tản mát. Chỉ khi ấy tôi mới vào lớp giải tích, ngồi xuống ngay sau khi thầy Jiminez bắt đầu một bài học lê thê vô tận khác.
vi_translation: I know these hallways all too well–and eventually, I even started to feel that they knew me. I was still standing there when the third bell rang and the crowd began to disperse. Only then did I enter the calculus class, sitting down right after Mr. Jiminez began another interminable lecture.

en: A few minutes later, as I glanced toward the clock for only the thirty-seventh time, I saw Ben Starling standing outside the classroom door, a hall pass in his hand, dancing a spastic jig.
es: A los pocos minutos, al mirar el reloj solo por trigésimo séptima vez, vi a Ben Starling al otro lado de la puerta de la clase, pegándose un bailoteo espasmódico y con un permiso para estar fuera de clase en la mano.
es_translation: A few minutes later, after looking at the clock for only the thirty-seventh time, I saw Ben Starling on the other side of the classroom door, doing a jerky dance and holding a hall pass in his hand.
